result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond E. Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond E. Schroeder is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond E. Schroeder was found guilty of Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Raymond E. Schroeder was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  *  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Parise acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  On State's motion, cts 1, 2 & 5 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 3 & 4.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 3 & 4.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 12 months w/conditions, concurrent on cts 3 & 4; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $450 DNA surcharge, bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Parise reports that the case is resolved.  PLEAH set for 3/7/17 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Parise states he believes the case is resolved and ADA Phan just needs to obtain DA approval.  FPT continued to 3/1/17 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Atty Parise indicates he completed AODA treatment but is still has additional treatment to complete.  Atty Phan and Atty Parise make a joint request for a final pre-trial about 3 weeks out so that they can discuss the case.  FPT set for 2/9/17 @ 8:45.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clerk/H. Barnett. ADA Phan and Atty Parise request a new trial case, it's possible case could be resolved.  JS set for 5/31/16 at 8:30am, pick & go.  Bond continued.
